text: What is the relationship between the diameter or radius of a circle and its circumference? Describe a strategy for finding the circumference of a circle.

It is a proportional relationship between the diameter of a circle and its circumference. When you know the diameter, then you can find its circumference and vice versa. The ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter is approximately 3. You can also write an equation, c≈3•d, where c represents circumference and d represents diameter. If you want to use radius instead of diameter, you can write c≈6•r, where c means circumference and r means radius.
